org.kissweb.database

Class Record

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.kissweb.database.Record
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    java.lang.AutoCloseable

    public class Record
extends java.lang.Object
implements java.lang.AutoCloseable
    Instances of this class represent a single row in a table or a row in a result set.

    There are two ways of getting instances of this class. The first way is by doing a select against the database. In that case, a Record or list of Record's is returned. The other way is to create a new row or record for inseration into the database. In that case, one should create the new Record instance as follows:

         Record rec = db.newRecord('myTable');

    where db is a Connection instance.
    See Also:
    Connection.newRecord(String), Connection.fetchAll(String, Object...), Connection.fetchOne(String, Object...), Command.fetchAll(String, Object...), Command.fetchOne(String, Object...)

      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      boolean addRecord()
      Inserts a new row into the database by creating an executing an SQL statement.
      java.lang.Object addRecordAutoInc()
      Works like addRecord() except that it returns the value of the serial/primary key column that the database used for the new record.
      Record clear()
      Erases all the column information associated with a Record instance.

      • update

        public void update()
            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Performs an SQL update on the record. This is done by creating an actual update statement and executing it against the database. It does not affect any cursors.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • delete

        public void delete()
            throws java.sql.SQLException
        Performs an SQL delete on the record. This is done by creating an actual update statement and executing it against the database. It does not affect any cursors.
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException

      • addRecordAutoInc

        public java.lang.Object addRecordAutoInc()
                                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Works like addRecord() except that it returns the value of the serial/primary key column that the database used for the new record.
        Returns:
        an Object - should be cast to (short), (int), or (long) depending on the serial type
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        See Also:
        addRecord()

      • addRecord

        public boolean addRecord()
                  throws java.sql.SQLException
        Inserts a new row into the database by creating an executing an SQL statement. It does not affect any cursors.
        Returns:
        Throws:
        java.sql.SQLException
        See Also:
        addRecordAutoInc()

      • close

        public void close()
        Closes any open prepared statements against this record. It is not normally needed since this class implements the AutoCloseable interface.
        Specified by:
        close in interface java.lang.AutoCloseable
